jvdrean - (10:55): @all Raluca has improvements for the datepicker application on contrib, I'd like to grant her access to the contrib repo; Should I send a vote ?  
rstavro joined #xwiki at 10:57  
vmassol - (11:01): she needs to ask for access on the list IMO  
vmassol - (11:01): just asking is enough  
vmassol - (11:01): explaining what she wants to work on  
vmassol - (11:01): then a committer grants her access  
jvdrean - (11:02): ok, that was my first tought actually :)  
jvdrean - (11:02): [4/15/10 7:11:22 PM] Jean-Vincent Drean: 2/ ask for a svn account on [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) saying that you'd like to contrib to the datepicker app

jvdrean - (11:03): s/we//

CalebJamesDeLisl - (12:05): Bed time for me. nn  
vmassol - (12:05): gn CalebJamesDeLisl  
vmassol - (12:21): jvdrean: trunk doesn't build for me  
vmassol - (12:21): analyzing why now  
npm left at 12:38 (Ping timeout: 258 seconds  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 12:40  
vmassol - (12:44): so the pb is that you cannot build platform by exlucindg tests  
vmassol - (12:44): (at least not for the first run)  
vmassol - (12:45): test jars are not created if you do  
vmassol - (12:45): excluding tests = -Dmaven.test.skip=true  
vmassol - (12:45): I'm surprised the jar wasn't retrieved from our remote repo though  
vmassol - (12:45): (should have been there by now)  
tmortagne - (12:46): use -DskipTest instead  
tmortagne - (12:46): (will build but not execute tests)  
vmassol - (12:47): yep good point  
vmassol - (12:48): http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-surefire-plugin/examples/skipping-test.html  
vmassol - (12:50): it's -DskipTests btw  
vmassol - (13:11): hmm now it's enterprise not building  
vmassol - (13:11): it has wrong deps  
vmassol - (13:12): fixing  
rstavro left at 13:12 (  
vmassol - (13:14): almost every time we release we have issues in dep updates, we should find a way to improve the proess  
vmassol - (13:14): (to make it easy for release managers)

evalica - (14:27): do you know who is gonna take care of the Selective Export integration in the platform?  
evalica - (14:28): are we gonna use the existing code for the Multi Page export application?  
evalica - (14:28): or we need to implement one from scratch  
sdumitriu - (14:28): jvelo could do it, since he already did the import  
sdumitriu - (14:28): Or I can, after I finish the poll  
evalica - (14:28): Selective Export Application: it allows to select a space and choose  which page to export in your package  
evalica - (14:29): is this the difference between .. Selective Export and Multi page Export? :)  
vmassol - (14:29): for me it's the same  
evalica - (14:29): one is letting you see the space and select the pages ... and the other is using the search feature to select the pages?  
vmassol - (14:29): it's one feature  
vmassol - (14:29): then we need to decide the options we want to have  
vmassol - (14:30): to select the pages/spaces  
evalica - (14:30): I need to know if I just need to remake the UI from the Multi page export - to be in the colibri style ... or I need to think of another interface  
vmassol - (14:30): we should define a spec first probably  
vmassol - (14:30): and agree on it  
vmassol - (14:31): maybe you could prepare a first version evalica?  
glerouge - (14:31): there are 2 parts  
glerouge - (14:31): \* selecting a set of pages  
sdumitriu - (14:31): evalica: Differences are in UI/UX mostly  
evalica - (14:31): I could gather some specs  
sdumitriu - (14:31): They do the same thing in the end  
glerouge - (14:31): \* deciding wht to do with those pages  
vmassol - (14:32): glerouge: wdym by the second part? is there something else than exporting them?  
glerouge - (14:32): vmassol -> from a user pov exporting a XAR for a backup and creating a composite PDF document isn't exposed the same way in the UI I guess  
vmassol - (14:33): for the selection indeed, it could be a bit like the insert link UI with tabs for: tree, recent pages you've navigated to, search  
evalica - (14:33): for the PDF export should we include the options glerouge add in his PDF export panel?  
vmassol - (14:33): then you click a button to move the selected pages to the target list of pages to export  
glerouge - (14:33): caty -> that's part 2 (deciding what to do with the pages)  
vmassol - (14:33): and yes this should be the same UI for PDF, RTF, XAR, etc  
glerouge - (14:34): step 1 is deciding what to export, step 2 is deciding what to do with the selected pages  
tmortagne - (14:34): +1 for common selection tool  
glerouge - (14:34): (export them as PDF with their comments, export them as a XAR with backup pack etc)  
vmassol - (14:35): we'll need to decide if we want new export actions at the level of the space and wiki menus  
vmassol - (14:35): or whether we offer single export actions in the wiki menu for example  
vmassol - (14:36): and then pre select the current page for ex  
evalica - (14:36): should we have some link in the menu that say: "Add page to export list" ?  
glerouge - (14:36): evalica: so for now you can start with a proposal for an interface allowing to select multiple wiki documents (it's a tough one already, specially for big wikis)  
vmassol - (14:36): evalica: IMO it's a dedicated UI  
vmassol - (14:36): (not add page to export list)  
glerouge - (14:37): vmassol: could be both  
vmassol - (14:37): glerouge: I really don't see how that would work  
vmassol - (14:37): you'd need to store the list somewhere  
vmassol - (14:37): and it's clumsy as a usage IMO  
glerouge - (14:37): a bit like a basket on an online website  
glerouge - (14:37): I agree that it's not the first one I would have thought about either  
glerouge - (14:38): back to the multiple document selection UI -> it's a tough one, specially for big wikis (we've seen how the tree behaves)  
glerouge - (14:38): (or, more accurately, how the tree does not behave)  
vmassol - (14:38): idea too: use a livetable to select pages  
vmassol - (14:38): (in order to do the filtering easily)  
glerouge - (14:39): vmassol: that's a suggestion for the selection of pages, maybe there are better ones  
vmassol - (14:39): filter then click add to add all selected pages, repeat  
evalica - (14:39): vmassol: I think there is no UI - that you haven't propose to use the livetable :)  
vmassol - (14:39): evalica: right :)  
glerouge - (14:39): lol  
glerouge - (14:39): he likes generic components  
vmassol - (14:39): I really like the filtering ability  
sdumitriu - (14:39): Livetable + select all this page, select all matched pages  
vmassol - (14:39): and yes I do like generi stuff  
glerouge - (14:39): sdumitriu: yes, adding bulk actions to the livetable is the next step  
glerouge - (14:39): select all,  
glerouge - (14:40): + actions  
glerouge - (14:40): (like gmail)  
vmassol - (14:40): next step = ? I think we should consider an extended livetable for this use case  
glerouge - (14:40): it would be useful for the export, for delete too  
glerouge - (14:40): vmassol -> the next option to add to the livetable  
vmassol - (14:40): meaning that maybe it's time to improve the livetable now for this use case  
glerouge - (14:40): (as if it didn't already have enough)  
vmassol - (14:40): rather than do this use case and later improve the livetable  
glerouge - (14:41): the livetable has already been imported a lot lately  
glerouge - (14:41): and it's use cases are only going to grow so indeed maybe a refactor could be good  
sdumitriu - (14:41): s/imported/improved ?  
glerouge - (14:41): imported -> improved  
glerouge - (14:42): (another feature I've been asked for is export the current livetable selection as an Excel file for instance)  
vmassol - (14:42): glerouge: like jira ....  
glerouge - (14:42): evalica: good luck now ;)  
evalica - (14:43): :) thanks  
vmassol - (14:44): the good thing of Livetable vs tree is that the livetable scales, the bad part is that you can't navigate hierarchically  
vmassol - (14:45): so one tab with livetable, one tab with tree, one tab with search  
vmassol - (14:45): :)  
tmortagne - (14:45): could be a livetree :)  
vmassol - (14:45): yes livetree for the tree tab  
sdumitriu - (14:45): We need to rewrite the tree anyway  
vmassol - (14:45): seriously the 3 tabs might not be a bad idea  
vmassol - (14:46): since there's no a single way to find information  
vmassol - (14:46): s/no/not/  
evalica - (14:47): and we need 3 tabs just for the selection part ...  
vmassol - (14:47): yes htat's the left part  
vmassol - (14:47): the right part is the aggreated list of spaces/pages to export  
vmassol - (14:48): and the bottom part are the export options (for ex)  
evalica - (14:48): and then we need the export options / type ... xar, pdf (include what ...)  
evalica - (14:48): yeap  
lucaa left #xwiki at 14:48  
vmassol - (14:48): evalica: I think we'd have different UIs  
vmassol - (14:48): but using common parts  
vmassol - (14:49): well I don't know  
vmassol - (14:49): we could decide to have a single unifying one for all exports too  
vmassol - (14:49): I'm neutral  
evalica - (14:49): k .. thanks .. I'll think about it  
vmassol - (14:49): just might be a bit crowsed  
vmassol - (14:49): crowded  
vmassol - (14:49): ok cool  
evalica - (14:49): the import / export should have the same look and feel  
evalica - (14:49): or .. we'll see :P  
vmassol - (14:50): it's also possible  
vmassol - (14:50): to change the UI for the import  
vmassol - (14:50): I'm not sure it was heavily designed/reviewed  
vmassol - (14:50): I have various nitpicks with it ;)  
glerouge - (14:50): yeah, let's rewrite XWiki while we're at it  
glerouge - (14:50): :p  
vmassol - (14:51): (so L&F yes, same ui components, not sure)

vmassol left at 16:30 (Quit: Leaving.

mflorea - (16:30): in which class?  
sdumitriu - (16:30): You can change the PollOptionClass to use it again  
mflorea - (16:31): ok, I'll do that, thanks (I have the poll app installed locally)  
sdumitriu - (16:31): But I don't know more details, ask Silvia what browser did she use  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 16:33  
mflorea - (16:56): sdumitriu: I can't reproduce the issues locally. Is "refHTML" id used in you code? I can't find it in the generated HTML and the editor doesn't generate it. So from where does it come from?.. Anyway, I'll ask Silvia what browser did she used.  
sdumitriu - (16:56): Nope  
sdumitriu - (16:57): I can't reproduce it either  
mflorea - (16:57): ok, thanks, I'll wait for Silvia

tmortagne joined #xwiki at 17:22  
xenon75 left at 17:35 (Quit: Leaving.  
sdumitriu - (17:41): mflorea: When can you take care of XWIKI-4894?  
mflorea - (17:43): today, if you need it asap  
mflorea - (17:44): sdumitriu: you need it for 2.3 final?  
florinciu left at 17:44 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
sdumitriu - (17:44): mflorea: Not urgent  
sdumitriu - (17:44): But it's nice to have and would make life easier for other scripts  
sdumitriu - (17:44): And we're adding events to all our components  
sdumitriu - (17:45): tabs, livetable, edit actions...  
mflorea - (17:45): right  
mflorea - (17:46): I'm handling some issues with links now (special characters) and I'll add the event afterwards  
sdumitriu - (17:47): So, what would be nice:  
sdumitriu - (17:47): xwiki:wysiwyg:loaded when it's fully loaded  
sdumitriu - (17:47): xwiki:wysiwyg:showingSource when the source tab was clicked and started loading the source  
sdumitriu - (17:47): xwiki:wysiwyg:showSource when the source tab has loaded  
sdumitriu - (17:47): xwiki:wysiwyg:showingWysiwyg when the wys tab was clicked and started loading the content  
sdumitriu - (17:47): xwiki:wysiwyg:showWysiwyg when the wys tab has loaded  
sdumitriu - (17:47): I'm not sure how can you nicely integrate with prototype  
sdumitriu - (17:47): So that it shouldn't fail if prototype is not present  
mflorea - (17:51): I can expose this events first without using prototype and add a xwiki special js that catches this events and triggers prototype events  
mflorea - (17:52): sdumitriu: I'll add a comment to the jira issue with the additional events
